result.execSummary:
The defendant Cheng NMI Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cheng NMI Yang is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cheng NMI Yang was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Cheng NMI Yang was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Per Judge Waterman on 10/3/22- AMEND JOC to reflect correct DOB 1/8/1987. 

- Report to probation by 2:00 PM on 6/1/22.
- 28 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: - Restitution to be held open for 7 days.

- $243 Court Costs. Payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County Case 22CF95.
- $200 DNA Surcharge. Payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County Case 22CF95.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Prescribed medications only as prescribed.
- No contact with Kay Lee, V.Y., Miguel N. or residence without Agent approval.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Comply with mental health treatment plan.
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested.
- AODA and follow through with recommendations.

11:51 AM  CO: RMW , REP: K.Malsom, CLERK: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Cheng NMI Yang appeared from jail. Court reviews case. Atty Chapman recites resolution. S/T DE. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 1: Criminal Damage to Property- 943.01 and Count 2:  Receiving or concealing stolen property-943.34(1)(a). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Count 3 and 4. Sentencing arguments. Victim rights in compliance. 

Court Orders:

Count 1: W/S 2 Years Probation

- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Payable through Probation
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Payable through Probation
- DNA Sample
- Comply with Mental Health Treatment Plan
- AODA and follow through with recommendations
- Absoulute Sobriety
- Prescribed medications only as prescribed
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- N/C with Kay Lee, V.Y.,  Miguel N or residence without agent approval
- Report to probation by 06/01/22 by 02:00PM.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Cheng NMI Yang appeared from jail. Case called at 2:14 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. ADA Smestad calls Deputy Benson to the Stand. S/T Joel Benson. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Smestad. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Chapman. Witness excused. No further evidence by either party. ADA Smestad gives argument. Atty Chapman gives argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court schedules arraignment. Atty Chapman requesting a bond hearing or plea hearing. Court adjourned at 2:25 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.

01:21 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Cheng NMI Yang appeared from jail. Court reviews case. Atty Smestad has spoken with Atty Chapman and recieved medical information and awaiting medical verification. Spoke about resolution. Atty Harrelson spoke with Atty Chapmand and wishes to not make bond argument today. Adjourned

per EFV on 05/04/22. hml

Faxed to Dispatch, Quash Sheriff & Jail

Bail/bond hearing on May 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

** AMENDED **

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kay Lee, V.Y.,  Miguel N or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

02:06 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson with Intern Kaitlyn Dippolito, DF: Cheng NMI Yang appeared from jail. Court reviews case. Intern Dippolito states DE had medical issues and that is why DE failed to appear. Intern Dippolito states DE was picked up.  ADA Smestad requests Cash Bond. Court Amends Bond. Court notes will consider amending with proof of medical papers. Court sets BBH. Court sets PH in Branch 4. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
